term.title: spinodal

item.text: Curve defining the region of composition and temperature for a binary mixture across which a transition occurs from conditions where single-phase mixtures are metastable to conditions where single-phase mixtures are unstable and undergo phase separation by spinodal decomposition.

notes.item: The spinodal curve for a binary mixture is defined as the geometrical locus of all states with (∂2ΔmixG/∂ϕ2)T,p = 0.
In the unstable region bounded by the spinodal curve, phase domain separation is spontaneous, i.e., no nucleation step is required to initiate the separation process.

sources.item: PAC, 2004, 76, 1985. 'Definition of terms related to polymer blends, composites, and multiphase polymeric materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2004)' on page 1998 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200476111985)
